page.title: 10The Local Dialect.
page.content: It was a cold, windy February day and we were fed up. There was{nowt}to do. Mum was{crammed,}she'd{walloped}me just because me and John had had a bit of a{tussle}over him{yapping}too much. Then I'd{rorked}my hand on the wall running away down the{ginnel.}Then it came to me, "Let's go{sniggling."} We set off up a steep{brew}on to the moors. I lit a match and{wuzzed}it on to the dry tussocky grass. It flared up in the strong wind and the blaze quickly spread. We were{fleyed} and ran to get some{watter}from a bog. We{teemed}a can full on{bout}it {dousing}the flames. John was{bawling} so we{scarpered}through a{steal-hoil} in wall, hoping wall{ud}stop flames.
